1.title: Automotive Heroes of Black History Month
1.subtitle: Ever wonder what driving would be like without turn signals or traffic lights? Well, without these great inventors, engineers, scientists, and pioneers of their field, driving wouldn’t be what it is today! In celebration of Black History Month, we want to share a few of their exciting stories with you.

1.title: Abolish Prison Labor in the USA
1.subtitle: Prison labor is a form of modern American slavery used by multiple large corporations across the world. Under the 13th Amendment to the United States Constitution, slavery was merely reformed rather than abolished. Racial justice in the USA cannot be achieved until prison labor is abolished completely.

2.title: First police report in Tyre Nichols case does not match video
2.subtitle: An initial police report filed in the hours after the Tyre Nichols traffic stop suggested he was violent and made claims that were contradicted by video later released by police.

4.subtitle: UNCF envisions a nation where all Americans have equal access to a college education that prepares them for rich intellectual lives, competitive and fulfilling careers, engaged citizenship and service to our nation.

4.title: Just Mercy: A Story of Justice and Redemption
4.subtitle: An unforgettable true story about the potential for mercy to redeem us, and a clarion call to end mass incarceration in America — from one of the most inspiring lawyers of our time.

6.title: Does racism affect how you vote?
6.subtitle: Nate Silver has data that answers big questions about race in politics. For instance, in the 2008 presidential race, did Obama's skin color actually keep him from getting votes in some parts of the country? Stats and myths collide in this fascinating talk that ends with a remarkable insight.

7.title: 3 Drs. & A Plan
7.subtitle:
3 Drs. & A Plan was created out of the drive to help goal-driven educators pursue their dreams. You have a bright future ahead of you but you may not know the right steps to take or how to get started. With our trained life coaches and educational career advisors, we will help you set attainable goals and create the right plan to make your hopes and wishes come true. 

As a life coach and career consultant, we help teachers deal with issues on an individual basis and determine the proper strategy for their needs.

7.title: #ChooseToChallenge - International Women's Day
7.subtitle: A challenged world is an alert world. Individually, we're all responsible for our own thoughts and actions - all day, every day. We can all choose to challenge and call out gender bias and inequality. We can all choose to seek out and celebrate women's achievements. Collectively, we can all help create an inclusive world. From challenge comes change, so let's all choose to challenge.

8.title: Legends profile: Michael Jordan
8.subtitle: By acclamation, Michael Jordan is the greatest basketball player of all time. Although, a summary of his basketball career and influence on the game inevitably fails to do it justice, as a phenomenal athlete with a unique combination of fundamental soundness, grace, speed, power, artistry, improvisational ability and an unquenchable competitive desire, Jordan single-handedly redefined the NBA superstar.

8.title: Bossa Bars

9.subtitle: Sweet Pea Books is dedicated to producing multicultural books that expose, inspire, amuse, and foster a love of reading in all children. Sweet Pea Books aims to promote the development of good character by teaching values through literature as well as expose young readers to different cultures.

products.name: D Is For Dragon Fruit (Hardcover)

products.name: When Mama Braids My Hair (Hardcover)
products.description: When Mama Braids My Hair captures a young girl’s experience of having her hair braided and the bond it creates with her mother. The tradition of African hair braiding is more than just a Sunday routine. Come join Nikki on an adventure as she is transformed into an Egyptian queen, a Nigerian goddess, a Zulu warrior, and a Maasai girl.

products.name: Elephants Don't Have Stripes! (COMING SOON!)
products.description: Elephants Don’t Have Stripes! Deep in the valley, in the dry grasslands of the African savanna, a young elephant admires other animals for their beauty. He yearns to look and act more like them. One by one, each wish comes true and the young elephant couldn’t be happier.

11.title: Text a bot for book suggestions
11.subtitle: Twitter user @ecmoy created a bot that you can text for recommendations of books written by Black authors based on genre. It will also link you to a Black-owned bookstore that is selling the title. Text (409) 404-0403 to try it!

11.title: Sports Can Battle Racism Workshop
11.subtitle: A workshop for coaches on how to ensure that sports is an inclusive environment for ALL athletes.
11.moreInfo: In this 90 minute workshop, coaches will have an interactive discussion on how to combat racial discrimination, champion moral courage and empower their programs to create positive change in their communities.

12.title: Black Lives Matter
12.subtitle: We appreciate your support of the movement and our ongoing fight to end state-sanctioned violence, liberate Black people, and end white supremacy forever.

12.title: How the Negro National League Was Formed | Field of Dreams...Deferred
12.subtitle: The Negro National League debuted 100 years ago with world-class players and legions of fans. Hear how founder Rube Foster formed the league in Part 1 of "Field of Dreams...Deferred," a four-part series from TBS.

13.title: Here Are the 18 African-American Astronauts
13.subtitle: It was 22 years after Alan Shepard’s first space trip that the U.S. sent a person of color up.

13.title: Inn8 Apparel
13.subtitle: Your mind. Your body. Your individuality. Your imperfections. These are the things you are born with. They are innate. Embrace them. They are yours. Celebrate them. They are yours. Love them. They are you.

Our home office is located in Vallejo, California. and we sell books throughout the US, Canada and select Markets around the world.

15.title: African-American Heroism in the Military
15.subtitle: Dating all the way back to the American Revolution, African-Americans have played key roles in the history (and success) of the U.S. military. Profiled below are some notable African-Americans and their achievements, as well as milestones in the integration of African-Americans in the U.S. military.

15.title: Free Minds Book Club
15.subtitle: Change lives today. Donate now to support incarcerated and formerly incarcerated youths and adults.

16.title: Justice for Dominique Fells
16.subtitle: June 9th, another black trans woman named Dominique Fells was murdered and thrown in a river. The violence against black trans women needs to stop. We cannot allow for the murder of this young woman to go unpunished.

16.title: Racial Literacy: What Does it Mean?
16.subtitle: What is your first memory of racial difference? Unfortunately, our education system doesn’t include a standard explanation to our young people of the history of the creation of the concept of race (or critical race theory). Learn today what you should've in school.

17.title: Did you really just say that?
17.subtitle: Here's advice on how to confront microaggressions, whether you're a target, bystander or perpetrator

18.title: Constance Baker Motley: Judiciary’s Unsung Rights Hero
18.subtitle: Constance Baker Motley was an unlikely civil rights hero. An African American who grew up near Yale University, she did not personally experience overt racism until late in high school, and as a young person she was almost totally unaware of black history.

18.title: Daunte Wright was stopped for expired plates, but driving while Black may have been his 'crime'
18.subtitle: The police confrontation escalated after officers saw what could have been an air freshener hanging illegally from the rearview mirror.

19.title: Coral Oral
19.subtitle: Not only are these toothbrushes more aesthetically pleasing, you differentiate each brush by its pattern and not by its color. Our company is proudly black owned and highlights oral health facts including a Black history fact that we all should know!

19.title: The police who killed Tyre Nichols were Black. But they might still have been driven by racism
19.subtitle: CNN's Van Jones puts his thoughts to paper in this opinion piece in the role racism played in the killing of Tyre Nichols at the hands of 5 Black police officers in Memphis.

20.title: An interview with the founders of Black Lives Matter
20.subtitle: In this spirited conversation with Mia Birdsong, the movement's three founders share what they've learned about leadership and what provides them with hope and inspiration in the face of painful realities. Their advice on how to participate in ensuring freedom for everybody: join something, start something and "sharpen each other, so that we all can rise."

20.title: What If I Don't Move to the Back of the Bus?
20.subtitle: Rosa Parks brought together a unique blend of life experiences, a commitment to racial justice, and a flawless reputation to transform a single act of defiance into a defining moment for the modern American civil rights movement.

21.title: When the first all-black professional basketball team dominated...back in the ’20s
21.subtitle: "They were literally pioneers and recognized that they were making a statement in front of the audiences."

21.title: Demand Justice for Casey Christian Goodson Jr
21.subtitle: On Friday, December 4th, 23 year-old Casey Christian Goodson Jr, was shot three times in the back and murdered by police. They mistook his subway sandwich for a gun. Sign this petition to demand justice.

22.title: The Hate U Give
22.subtitle: Based on the best-selling novel, The Hate U Give tells the story of Starr Carter, who lives in two worlds: the poor, black neighborhood where she resides and the mostly white prep school she attends. This uneasy balance is shattered when she witnesses the fatal shooting of her childhood friend by a policeman. Facing pressures from all sides, Starr must find her voice and stand up for what’s right.

22.title: How we can make racism a solvable problem — and improve policing
22.subtitle: When we define racism as behaviors instead of feelings, we can measure it — and transform it from an impossible problem into a solvable one, says justice scientist Dr. Phillip Atiba Goff. In an actionable talk, he shares his work at the Center for Policing Equity, an organization that helps police departments diagnose and track racial gaps in policing in order to eliminate them.

23.title: How to be an Antiracist
23.subtitle: This conversation with professor Ibram X. Kendi was recorded during the 2019 Aspen Ideas Festival in Aspen, Colorado. In it, he explores what an antiracist society might look like, how we can play an active role in building it, and what being an antiracist in your own context might mean.

23.title: Hiram Rhodes Revels - Biography
23.subtitle: A freeman his entire life, Hiram Rhodes Revels was the first African American to serve in the U.S. Congress. With his moderate political orientation and oratorical skills honed from years as a preacher, Revels filled a vacant seat in the United States Senate in 1870.

24.title: Sugarfoots

27.title: Why Seeing Yourself Represented on Screen Is So Important
27.subtitle: "Black Panther" has been hailed as a model success story for depicting diversity on screen. According to past research, the representation of minority groups in mass media has a powerful educational impact on audiences.

27.title: Racial Literacy: A Call to Action for Teachers
27.subtitle: Uprisings in the wake of George Floyd’s death at the hands of police and the worldwide reaction demanding racial justice represented a wake-up moment for schools. Talking about race will be essential if we are going to serve all students well.

28.subtitle: Police said the shooter has been charged with murder in what officials are calling a hate crime and a case of racially motivated violent extremism.

products.name: Ultimate Beard Kit

29.title: 210 Teas
29.subtitle:
Inspired by the 5 bags of black tea brewed  on my late grandmother’s stove, that were to later be stirred with sugar and offered to anyone that entered her kitchen, 210 Teas honors the subtle yet strong essence of my grandmother. For me, tea is a reminder of my family – a reminder of generational love. Tea provides a soothing sense of comfort that speaks without words, like the omnipresent protection of your ancestors.

The mission of 210 Teas is to share that comfort with everyone I can reach. From my cup … to yours, with love.

29.title: Doe Wiz Apparel
29.subtitle: Doe Wiz apparel was found by Kamar Doe Wiz Lewis. The term Doe came about from the street meaning "Money," and the term "Wiz" short for wisdom. By combining the two terms, we have the name "Doe Wiz" which means "A smart way to get money."

30.title: Harriet Tubman - Biography
30.subtitle: Harriet Tubman was an escaped enslaved woman who became a "conductor" on the Underground Railroad, leading enslaved people to freedom before the Civil War, all while carrying a bounty on her head. But she was also a nurse, a Union spy and a women’s suffrage supporter.

30.title: Robert Tanner Freeman - Bytes of History
30.subtitle: Robert Tanner Freeman was born in Washington DC in 1846. He was the son of slaves who had bought their freedom in the 19th century. Historical records are unclear but they probably adopted the surname Freeman in response to their transition.

31.title: Fight for Breonna
31.subtitle: Breonna survived the frontlines of a pandemic that disproportionately kills Black people, only to have her life stolen by police. Take Action.
